comment.text: I've heard so many great things about La Grotta and my boyfriend took me for an early valentines dinner. I was so excited for this. First of all, they have valet parking, you go inside and take elevator all the way down. We were sahmt down as soon as we arrived (reservations only) our waiter's name was Billy and he is probably one of the best waiters I've ever had!!! He was very helpful and guided us through the entire menu along with great recommendations. I had wild bore and it was a 10/10 my bf had a thick cut of veal also amazing!! But my absolute favorite was the dessert!! We had tiramisu and the chocolate torta.

Amazing , authentic italian restaurant! This is the best italian restaurant i've been to since i've moved to atlanta and let me tell you why:
1. I spoke to the owner Chris who let me know what was a good time for me to come to be accommodated without a reservation and they got me right in at the bar (apparently this place gets super busy even on week nights)
2. the bartender Amanda was lovely! she was attentive , even tho there was a rush.  she was very helpful and made an amazing espresso martini 
3. FOOD. was so good. i love that there's an option to get appetizer sizes, which allowed me to try two new things, both of which i absolutely LOVED. 
4. The ambiance of the restaurant was great. small, quaint place, but great for date nights, birthdays, anniversaries, you name it. All of the staff was very attentive and friendly to me. 
Safe to say i will be a regular here.

photos.caption: Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri

comment.text: Atlantas best kept secret! Absolutely amazing! Service, food.. everything! We've been going for years. The most authentic Italian you will get in Atlanta!

For my anniversary I came here with my wife. Needing to find something that we both love, La Grotta checked all the boxes. Italian, but not just normal Italian dishes. Something that has sort of everything and things we haven't seen before. 
I definitely have to say my time here was wonderful!

Parking is valet only, but it's complimentary. I mean, I tipped the valet so take it as you will. Walking down, the restaurant is not on a rooftop, but rather in the basement pretty much. After stepping out of the elevator it felt as if I was going into a cave, but it opens out into a big dining room and when we were there it was pretty packed. Since it seems that COVID-19 is over, no one wore masks so that was that. The seating wasn't really socially distanced either so if you're still worried about that keep that in mind. 

Food wise: For appetizers we ordered the Burrata di Mozzarella Fresca and the Carpaccio di Tonno con Avocado e Caperi. The cheese was fresh, and the tuna was magnificent. I would say though between the two on which was better would definitely be the cheese. Sadly, I did not do my due diligence as far as taking pictures of this because we just demolished the dish. It was gone as soon as it hit our table.

For mains, I got the Filetto di Manzo alla Toscana and it was great! Tomatoes definitely cut through and was just right. I think for sure that those tomatoes were the star of that dish. The meat, obviously was great but mixed all together was something different. I definitely recommend this dish. As a side, we shared wild mushrooms. It was alright, but I don't think it was worth what it was worth.

Dessert, I got the Tiramisu which was great. I think it was sort of on the sweet side, but otherwise I had no issues and enjoyed it.

Overall, I would definitely recommend La Grotta if you want an amazing date night with good Italian food.

Best Italian restaurant in Atlanta with great waitstaff and delicious food. In my last two visits here, I have enjoyed both the steak and the lobster pasta, along with a few appetizers such as the calamari and caprese salad. Cocktails are always on point and the desserts are also delicious.
Would be a full five stars, but at our last visit here, which was booked for 8pm, we ended up not getting seated until 9 or after. They must have severely overbooked this night, as people waiting for a table were stacked out from the host desk all the way back to the elevator. Even then, the food and service was well-worth the long wait.
Definitely of Atlanta icon you feel like you're going back in time when you enter the restaurant it's cozy and tucked away and the food is outstanding. I need to go there more often.

Overall review: meh.

My husband and I recently moved to Atlanta, and I wanted to bring him here for his birthday dinner as a special occasion. Unfortunately, neither one of us was impressed.

I'm not sure if it was an off night (Saturday during prime dinner time) but we found the food to be just mediocre. The service staff was kind and attentive, but the food honestly felt lackluster and dated. Even the vibes inside the restaurant made it seem like this place was in its hey-day 20 years ago.

We've since found other restaurants that we feel more closely match what we're looking for in a special occasion restaurant (for instance, Atlas, Lyla Lila, and Bacchanalia).

Not sure that we'll return to La Grotta anytime soon.

I cannot begin to describe the food I had for dinner. It was truly a magical experience. The staff was friendly and on top of everything, and the manager made sure to chat with each table during dinner service. As a regular pasta eater, I cannot believe I hadn't been here before. The underground entrance is very much like the grotto restaurants in Italy and I fully understand why it's been around for as long as it has. It deserves awards.

AmazIng service, food and ambience. 
Service is top notch with a classy patron base. We enjoyed all of it.

I made reservations weeks in advance as I heard this is a popular place and the "best," Italian spot. I got a call the day of my reservation to confirm our table and about the dress code. Upon our arrival, there was a line to check in at the podium as there was no host present. After some time, we were sat in the middle of a really small and busy restaurant. The restaurant space here was super tight. We felt like our elbows were touching the people behind us. 

Our server always seemed as if he was a in rush. Not once did our server make eye contact with us nor did he write down the specifics/accommodations we wanted in our dish. 

We ordered Shoot the Meese, chicken parm, mussels, sacchetti, and tortelini. 

Everything was just okay. The portions were small. Service was awful. We won't be back. We came here to celebrate a birthday and this clearly wasn't the best spot for it. We had really high expectations for this spot as this was recommended from a friend who swears by this place. We were told the dress code prior to our arrival, but there were multiple people sitting next to us wearing everything they said NOT to wear.

La Grotta is a hidden gem located in Buckhead on the garden level of a housing complex. We went for a dinner on a Thursday night and had a lovely time. This Italian restaurant prides itself on authentic cuisine and experience. We enjoyed great wine and food starting with Caesar salads  and escargot. We enjoyed the risotto and lobster dish. Great for a date night, ladies night, business meal, or family outing. 

Reservations are a must! Parking by valet. Service is great.

La Grotta was a hidden gem in Atlanta. You take the elevator downstairs and walk down a moody  hallway that makes it feel like you are in a cave, hense the name. After talking with the host the restaurant opened up in front of us and we were seated in the middle of the dining room. The restaurant was beautiful and upscale. They have floor to ceiling windows along one wall that give you a view out to their spacious patio. I wouldn't say that this restaurant is perfect for a one on one date night, it did lack some feel of intimacy with the layout of a large open dining room.  Our table of four ordered multiple small plates and well as a few entrees to all share. The hot appetizer of snails were amazing. The snails were prepared well and very tender and the spinach and cream gave the dish a perfect level of richness. The beef carpaccio was a welcome bite of acid following the snails. This was possibly the best carpaccio I've ever had. Our entrees were also well received with the table. Overall I would like to return to La Grotta but only with a group of friends or family.

photos.caption: Chiocciole Aglio Olio Con Spinaci- snails in butter, garlic, white wine and creamed spinach
Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri

comment.text: What a wonderful place. Classic recipes and an old school vibe. The service was wonderful. Our server had been there for 24 years and was from Italy. You could absolutely tell people have been coming here for yours. This is a dressy spot. I'll never come back without a jacket again.

Took my daughter here for her birthday last night . Her and her friends loved this place. All three of the appetizers that we ordered were excellent, and all four of our meals were very good. The veal Marcella was the best marsala sauce I've ever had, and I have spent some time in Italy. My daughters lobster in pasta dish was so good. My dish was a spicy shrimp and pasta, now I will say the shrimp was very fresh, and they were very big. excellent taramisu , and ricotta cheesecake. My only complaint is we had a 930 reservation, we were sat at about 9:50, the waiter checked his watch while talking with us, that was a clue, he told us we only had 10 minutes to order our entrée. We hadn't even ordered or appetizers yet or really looked through the menus. Now if we were at a wings join or pizza joint I could understand but we were going to drop $400 so I felt like that was completely inappropriate. Other than that it was a lovely evening. I know this restaurant is an OG in Buckhead so I'm glad i got a chance to take the girls.

Hey La Grotta, 

Yesterday was my parents 38th wedding anniversary. So, because they are wonderful parents, I decided to call you guys and ask if you could bring them a dessert at the end of the meal. A request I would imagine you all get semi-regularly. The host was very kind on the phone. I explained to please let them know their son John says happy anniversary. A piece of tiramisu, easy, paid for, great. Lovely. Life's good. 

Flash forward. I don't receive a text or call from my very communicative father after their meal. If the dessert had landed properly, they would have thanked me. Hm. Sirens in my brain going ringy dingy. 

Come to discover a dessert was brought to them and the waiter/waitress told my parents "IT WAS FROM A FRIEND". Not even a name. A friend. Someone from college perhaps? That neighbor down the road? A friend wanted you all to have a lovely dinner. Nailed it. 

I'm not mad, just disappointed. I've heard great things about this restaurant and thought a simple game of telephone would be an easy assignment. Please do better, as I was even charged 20% gratuity for this. I hope this is executed better for the next anniversary 

John

If there's an Italian restaurant I'm going to indulge in, this would be it. The food here is excellent and the service is great. 

I have tried a few things on the menu and nothing disappointed! 

This place is Great for a date night or a special occasion.

Opened since 1978, and coined as the first true Italian fine dining restaurant in Atlanta, I am glad to say this place is still around.  Being a former member at the church next door (Christ The King), I guess I always took it for granted and never came here.

To get started, this place (as many before me have said), is old school.  It is 42 years old, and only has 270 something yelp reviews.  That's because, well, it doesn't really need any, and the majority of the clientele does not use yelp.  Mostly, you will get the old money families here.  With that being said, you can enjoy a peaceful evening here for the most part (not those blistering loud places with screaming kids or drunk 20somethings).  

While coats are not required, they ask you doll up a little bit.  Shorts are not allowed in the dining room, but the patio is a little more relaxed.  I won't lie, I put on slacks and dress shoes, a lot different than my typical shorts, old work shirts, and steel toes.

They have valet here, or you can park literally next door.  The valet does share the same lot as the self park, so they are all under the same roof..  Those guys probably get a run for their money here.  Since this is located in a condo building in the basement, the staff asks you keep it quiet, as people do live here (the building itself opened in 1975).

Reservations, you better get them, unless you want to sit at the bar (which is small, but was empty tonight).  They offer outdoor and indoor seating.  We decided to sit outside, as it was a perfect night- no wind, perfect temp, perfect lighting.  As it got darker, they had cool market lighting come on.

Our server was Eduardo (sp?), and he was very friendly.  I also heard the staff here speaks 5 languages (German, Italian, English, French, and Spanish)- if it is a requirement for everyone, I am not sure- but that is pretty cool.  I heard they have a lot of long term servers here as well, which makes it great for repeat visits.

We decided to get a few apps (and mind you, due to space constraints, I will use the shorthand names)- the snails, the carpaccio, and the bufala caprese.  We also got bread along with torino sticks.

The carpaccio to start, was some of the best I have had.  With the cheese and seasoning, it was better than most wagyu carpacs I have had- this is a must try for meat and cheese lovers.   The snails, they were cooked perfectly, but just a tad under seasoned.  With the spinach, I scarfed em all.  And, the caprese, which I am not usually a fan of tomatoes, everything melded well together.  It was all fresh and I enjoyed it immensely.  

For dinner, I ordered the chicken parm, and a side of fettucine alfredo.  I also put in an order for later for mom (a entrée fettucine alfredo and asparagus) to bring home.

The chicken parm, I wont lie, again, was some of the best I have had.  Since it was not overly breaded, the integrity of the breasts were spot on- along with the sauce and cheese.  So juicy.  The pasta was nice with it.  However, when I had that side of fettucine, I was actually thinking about eating mom's on the way home.  

Dessert, I had the panna cotta.  That was spectacular as well.  They have a full bar and a lot of old school drinks to offer here as well, especially for dessert, but I opted out like a sober little Tommy (that drink wall did get my hand shaking though!).

When it was time to get the check, I realized the togo stuff was not on there, Eduardo apologized and rectified that quickly.  I guess that worked out though because- he still remembered what I wanted, and it came out later, so it stayed warmer for the 30 min drive home.  No harm no foul.

The really only thing that prevented 5 stars for me were these 2 things- first, not all staff had gloves (which you know people can take it as they wish).  But next, they seated a 16 top outside, and the people, well, they brought a few bottles of wine from home (which they vehemently state on their menu and online they do not accept outside bottles at this time)- so I am not sure why they were the exception to that rule.  Sorry, but trying to keep everyone safe, means everyone needs to play by the rules, or don't have them at all- but that is just me.

Also, one more thing, keep an eye out for black truffle season, as they have a menu with new items pertaining to it, or you can add it shaved to any dish for $22.95.  Also, make sure you check out the specials.

Is this the best Italian in Atlanta?  That is a tough call.  But, with the years of regulars, they keep coming back for a reason.  I am sure the consistent top notch service, the privacy, and the old world flavors have a lot to do with it- I mean, and the fact it is in the basement of a 45 yo condo building, it really is in a class of its own.  So I will leave at this- if you are a fan of Italian cuisine, this is not to be missed.  I mean also, the prices aren't that bad either, and I actually left full and satisfied, but not with overbearing pastasweats.

I visited La Grotta for the first time this evening for a work dinner. I have been somewhat disappointed with service at good restaurants in Atlanta since COVID (I get it, restaurants are short staffed everywhere, but at some places you expect the best given what you're paying). Service at La Grotta was impeccable. Our lead server (Brett or Brent, it was a little loud and I was across the table) was knowledgeable, present just when needed but not hovering, and ready to make recommendations given no one at the table had dined there before. We had 6 people in our party. 

Pre-dinner drinks were mostly classics (Negroni, Manhattan, etc.). My dirty martini was ice-cold, perfectly briny, and they stuff their own blue cheese olives. Some places have stopped doing that and I hate it. Pre-stuffed olives are horrifically bad. Strong start!

We all ordered the mixed pasta appetizer, which is essentially a greatest hits of their pasta dishes: one bite of three different pasta dishes for each of us; we left the selection to our server's recommendation. He opted for a short rib filled tortellini-like item; sacchetti with fontina, cream, and truffle; and a portobello ravioli. All were excellent, but the short rib dish was the least memorable. I would order either the sacchetti and mushroom ravioli as an entree in a heartbeat.

We followed this with a poached pear bruschetta course. Delicate and delicious.

For entrees, most of us ordered the evening specials. 2 folks ordered a snapper dish that met with high praise, and 2 of us (including me) ordered a "duck duo": seared and sliced duck breast and a duck leg confit over polenta. It was outstanding.

Desserts: following recommendations again, desserts ordered were panna cotta, tiramisu, and creme brûlée. I ordered creme brûlée (as I always do when it's on the menu and I'm getting dessert). It was a classic preparation, and expertly done and delicious. I also ordered coffee, which is why I'm writing this novel of a review at 12:38AM... damn it.

I look forward to coming back to La Grotta many times in the future, especially as I live less than a mile away. Great service, great food, and by no means overpriced: most entrees were $25-$30 dollars and I would pay more than that for the quality. It's been around for forever, and sure seems like it will be in the future: we had a 5:45PM reservation (they open at 5:30) and the restaurant was full from the moment we sat down until we left at 8:15.

Tip for gents: jackets are recommended. I didn't know this until a friend told me today, and I'm sure glad I was wearing one. More fellas were wearing them than not.
Awesome  food , great service and a beautiful ambiance. I love this place and hate I moved from Atlanta.

We're excited to be in the Peach State this week to visit family who live in Atlanta's Buckhead neighborhood.

For one of our weeknight family dinners, we grabbed an early reso at La Grotta, an Atlanta institution and a AAA 4-Diamond 
recipient for the last 20 years.  Atlanta Magazine also voted La Grotta as Atlanta's Best  Italian Restaurant for 18 consecutive years.  I was psyched for my first dining experience at La Grotta. 

This award-winning restaurant is located on a beautiful stretch of Peachtree Road in the heart of Buckhead.  On a beautiful Georgian evening, we opted to dine outdoors in the beautiful courtyard located adjacent to the main dining room. 

Our dinner began with a toast from a magnum of my favorite Italian wine...Brunello Di Montalcino. It was a great start to what would become an unquestioned 5-star dining experience. 

We started with a trio of both cold and hot appetizers along with a special off-menu appetizer of three unique pastas. Wow, what an awesome treat made by the chef who has continuously led the La Grotta kitchen for 43 consecutive years!

Our entrees ranged from the ever-popular bone-in Veal Parm to the Risotto del Giorno to the hearty Penne Bolognese to a pan-roasted Halibut Steak.  We also enjoyed several side dishes of Angel Hair pasta with marinara sauce. The five of us all raved about the quality and taste of our feast. 

Our knowledgeable lead server "Tex" did a masterful job of guiding us through the whole experience.   

La Grotta is Italian dining at its very finest...Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Off-menu trio of pasta appetizer...over the moon.
Sautéed escargots over creamed spinach appetizer...over the moon!

comment.text: Came in last night with my family for dinner. There were 6 of us. We made a reservation for 5:45 - that was the latest they had available. They fill up, so be sure to make a reservation well ahead of time! The dress code is business casual. Check the website for specifics. They have complimentary valet parking. I didn't notice anywhere to self park. The restaurant is located on the bottom floor of an condo complex. We sat inside, but they do have a lovely outdoor patio! Our waiter was great - very attentive and gave great suggestions. We started with some drinks. Our waiter suggested the pasta tasting that they provide for parties of 5 or larger. It came with a sample of 3 pastas for everyone to try. Very tasty. We all ordered entrees. We got the chicken parm with a substitute of carbonara, penne bolognese, tortellini, lobster pasta and a Caesar salad. It was all great! A cool dining experience.
Everything was sooo good! Pricing was super reasonable considering how much amazing food we got, and the service was great too. Great wine selection as well. The valet is super easy and convenient.

photos.caption: Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri

comment.text:
Cute little spot kind of hidden in like this cool dungeon sort of way! 

We had the snails, this peach bruschetta situation and the Burrata. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. The peach bruschetta was my favorite. (If you want the peach bruschetta you have to ask for it because it's not on the menu). Prices were actually very reasonable for a higher end restaurant. But the kicker was the Truffle Sacchetti! One of the best pasta dishes I've ever had in my entire life! It was so delicious I ordered another plate. I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri

comment.text:
Very confused by this place. Similar to other reviews, we heard this was the best Italian restaurant in the Atlanta area, which is why we booked in advance for my birthday dinner. We were wowed by the service and attentiveness of everyone that greeted and seated us. 

The restaurant has rustic appeal while walking in; however the food was disappointing. The cheese on the chicken parm was rubbery and my gnocchi was lacking flavor. Side note: don't get an appetizer size it's more like a sample. 

The server never mentioned my birthday despite being asked multiple times by the hostess if we were celebrating anything.

Personally, I don't like my tiramisu to have almond extract in it even though that's one of the more popular desserts.

The service was amazing nonetheless.

user.name: Annan G.
user.address: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

comment.text:
"I have been in this restaurant a few times. Having spent a lot of time in Italy I find this restaurant as authentic as you can find in Atlanta. The food has always been spectacular and the service too. This last time that I went I was extremely pleased by the service of Juliano, Danny and Jesus. They were extraordinarily nice an accommodating to my food allergies. I had a great time and I can't wait to go there again and be served by them.
The last thing is that they have a very great selection of wines and their prices are the cheapest I've seen in an upscale restaurant."

Disappointing is an understatement. To celebrate a major career achievement, we went to dinner at La Grotta. To begin, the restaurant is in an older building. While the entrance is nothing to look at, we were pleasantly surprised by how nice the interior of the restaurant was. But this is where the excellence stopped. The food is mediocre at best - I would actually say on par with an Italian chain restaurant like Olive Garden or Carrabbas but at 4x the price. Our waiter was unable to pronounce a single item on the menu and was rather rude and disruptive throughout the meal. I am genuinely confused where such positive reviews come from in regards to this restaurant. Save your time and money and bring them to a place with actual excellent Italian cooking.

Top restaurant in Atlanta. 
Veal is incredible. Old school Atlanta atmosphere. Incredible service.
La Grotta is absolutely amazing! The food was fresh & delicious and the service was excellent.

La Grotta is a true Atlanta institution and one of its gold standards for Italian cuisine; there is a reason it has endured for many years in the obscure bottom floor of a mid-century residential building.  From the time you get off the elevator, you truly feel like you're stepping into a refined cave (hence the name) with cozy lighting and a buzzy crowd of revelers, business men and couples on dates.  The space includes a small bar (perfect if you arrive a bit early) and there is also a decent sized patio for al fresco dining.  And the food?  Truly exceptional.  The meat entrees I have tried are all amazing and generously sized (try the Filetto di Manzo and thank me later); the pasta dishes are wonderful as well.  La Grotta is generally booked up well in advance, so do plan ahead with a reservation.

I heard great reviews for La Grotta so after moving here recently and Italian being my favorite cuisine it was a must. It was a bit hard to get a reservation so I decided to go for takeout since it's only 5 mins away and I knew it would still be fresh and hot. From my phone call that should've been the dead giveaway, acting all nice and professional while taking my order for take out to at the end asking me how much am I leaving for tip for the staff and once I respectfully declined as I don't do that for take out he instantly got so rude and unprofessional. Now that's just the customer service portion and no matter how bad that was if the food was good I'd say the honest truth. Not only was it bland with no flavor but it was cold dripping with oil and tasted like rubber. Horrible restaurant.
First timers. Really glad we were able to get a reservation.  It was everything talked about. 40+ years in the Atl.

photos.caption: Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri

comment.text:
Fantastic! I have heard how amazing this place was but I had to come to find out for myself. A group of three of us were very lucky to get a table on the patio on a Saturday night. The patio was beautiful, even on a chilly February night. 

For appetizers, we had beef rib ravioli and beef carpaccio. I highly recommend the beef rib ravioli, special of the night. 

For entrees, we had the scaloppine di Vitello Antonio (pass), Sacchetti di Formaggio (highly recommend), Sogliola di Dover (delicious), and Pappardelle Con Astice (amazing). I paired my entree with a nice glass of red, based on our server's recommendation. 

We ended the night with the tiramisu and an expresso.  

Amazing food! I talked about this meal for days with my friends.

We've not gone to La Grotta in several years, not for any special reason, just not gone.  Tonight we went for our 49th anniversary, and, afterwards, we wondered why we had been away for so long.  The food is wonderful, the prices aren't outlandish, and the service is definitely equal to the best anywhere in the city.  It was a wonderful evening.

Fairly new restaurant who is still waiting on their liquor license (currently BYOB which we loved) and working on a dessert menu. Be patient as they have a small staff, but oh is it worth it! Make a reservation if you can, they only have 6 tables. We got lucky and were able to get the last table for two on a Wednesday evening. The waitress was incredibly sweet and the food was even better. Authentic Italian cuisine and very charming!
The food was excellent. I had th salmon and it was great. The service was good and th server had a sense of humor. The ambiance was nice.

Absolutely amazing! I love the experience of finding this restaurant even! First time going and decided to sit in the patio and that was a great choice even though it was cold the night I went (they have lots of warmers to keep you warm).

For appetizers my party decided to get some of the pasta dishes to try. The best one was Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri. The dish was absolutely amazing! Highly recommend.

The Tortelloni Della Casa and Pappardelle Con Astice (lots of lobster in this one) both were really good as well! 

For mains we tried two of the  veal loin scaloppines and both were very tasty however I have had better veal dishes at other classic Italian restaurants. Next time I would try another protein and it seemed many around us were getting other mains. 

For dessert the tiramisu was very light and tasty and would recommend trying.

Overall, very good Italian food, all recommendations made by server were outstanding and would return for sure!
Incredible wine list and some of the best Italian food in Atlanta.  Always a great dining experience.

Absolutely stellar experience all around. We treated ourselves to a belated Valentine's Day dinner here, and I could not have asked for anything better. I asked our server for his recommendation for wine, and me not having a strong preference gave him a vague request and he still hit the mail on the head. We started with the calamari and a baby spinach salad with mushrooms and goat cheese, and both were perfectly prepared and even split by the chef before being brought out to us. For the main course, we got the Pappardelle con Astice and the Beggar's Purses. The former was absolutely loaded with lobster in a delicious wine sauce, and the latter was the best Truffle-centered course I've ever had. The Tiramisu and espresso martini for dessert left me speechless. All things considered, I would give the experience 5/5 stars, and considering the quantity of food and quality of service, I'd even consider this on the $$ side of "$$$". Will absolutely return again!

photos.caption: Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri

comment.text:
We took our daughter and son-in-law here for her birthday.  What a great place.  
The food and service was excellent.  We are from San Diego and this restaurant was recommended by a local foodie.
We definitely are coming back each time we visit ATL.

Honestly this place's reputation speaks for itself. Husband and I have been dying to go here next time we were in Atlanta and called and called until we must have gotten someone's cancelled reservation. (We were traveling last minute.)

The entire experience is so well thought out. We started with the burrata & prosciutto, which was delicious. We had veal & split an appetizer size of the gnocchi with truffles. My husband "doesn't like mushrooms" and devoured them. Everything was delicious and we will definitely be back!

Great Italian restaurant, the food was delicious, the masala pasta was amazing, great service, super friendly. On Valentine's day book almost 1 month in advance. They have valet parking, super atmosphere, outdoor tables. The owner was very friendly.

This is my absolute favorite restaurant Italian restaurant in atlanta.  I have come here for years, for special events, anniversaries, friends, family gathering it's always incredible.  It's as close as to having dinner in the Amalfi coast, Positano,  every dish is exquisite.    I'm strongly debating asking them to photograph their dishes and location.  Service is the BEST IN TOWN!

The Basics: La Grotta is an Italian restaurant located in Buckhead. When you pull up to the restaurant, you may think you are at the wrong location (it is located on the bottom floor of a condo complex); however, you will see the valet up front and know you actually have arrived. You take the elevator downstairs and the restaurant is quaint and authentic. The food is delicious, the wait staff is energetic and wonderful, and the restaurant as a whole feels like a hidden gem in Atlanta. 

Things I like: The food at La Grotta is authentic Italian food and is fresh and delicious. All of the pasta is homemade and the dishes are all delicious. They also have homemade limoncello! I have never had a bad meal here. One of my favorite dishes to order is the Gnocchi. The staff at La Grotta is also amazing. The waiters at the restaurant are often Italian and they all have big personalities that make you feel welcome. You will not be let down by the food or service here. 

Things I didn't like: Nothing! I have always loved my experience at La Grotta. However, it can be difficult to get a reservation here at times since the restaurant is small. I would suggest calling to make a reservation, some of the online booking sites are not accurate as to what their availability actually is on a given night. 

Overall, La Grotta is the place to come for fresh and authentic Italian food in Atlanta. It has an old school feel and a quaint dining room which adds to the amazing dining experience.

photos.caption: Sacchetti di Formaggio e Tartufi Neri with Tomato Sauce

comment.text: We have been coming here for 20 or more years. Always our favorite Atlanta Italian restaurant. That said when we sat down we were a party of 7 and we were presented a bread basket with 5 half slices of bread . Upon passing that around the table we asked for more and we're told it was five dollars for another basket? Are you kidding me? We having a 600 dollar plus dinner and they don't want to give a slice of bread for each person? Unbelievable. I've never heard of an upscale restaurant charging for bread.. bread costs Pennies to make...unfortunately started dinner off on a bad note.. only other issue was the mussels.. in the past they have been giant mussels these were absolutely minuscule, the meat inside like a tiny nibble....of course the sauce was delicious like always but unfortunately we didn't have any bread to mop it up.. dinner itself was fantastic, everyone loved their entrees... but please don't charge big parties for extra bread. That's insulting
The food was excellent. Even accommodated for vegan and allergies. It was old school and authentic. 10/10

I had the food back a little before Valentines Day. The experience is amazing. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful. I was really confused by entrance since it is located in apartment complex, and the staff was understanding that we came in the back garden. The space is a little tight so navigation to bathroom is a struggle. The soup of the day was amazing and signature tiramisu makes all other tiramisu pail in comparison. I will comeback for another occasion because the experience is everything you expect from fine dining

The exceptional dining experience from last night is still lingering in my sweet memories. The food and the service are both superb. Among all the fabulous Italian restaurants I have tried, La Grotta is one of the best.

La Grotta is located at the basement of a condo building on Peachtree St. It delivers an intimate, cozy ambiance within the dining room. You can also choose to sit at the "garden" as well, which would be very nice also. The service is excellent. There are two waitresses and a "bus boy" serving every table. Apart from catering to all our requests, they had shared some interesting, casual conversations with us.

What did we order?
We had white bean soup with drizzles with truffle oil as appetizer. The entree we ordered is grilled veal chop (added shaved French black truffles for $23/dish). The portion of the white bean soup is generous. I recommend sharing the soup between two people, so that you can save room for entree and desserts. The grilled veal chop is perfectly done. The veal comes out as "medium" temperature inside, and extremely juicy. Truffle shaving was done table-side. 

Even though having dinner here is not the cheapest, we appreciate our moments here every time. I highly recommend La Grotta to anyone.

photos.caption: Grilled veal chop with french black truffles

comment.text: Hidden gem in Buckhead area of Atlanta! We heard Pastor Chris at Church of the Highlands mention a great Italian place in Atlanta and we deducted that it was La Grotta and we're so glad he mentioned it. Driving by you'd never know it was a restaurant but don't be fooled. Complimentary valet up front where there's a sign to turn it. Then you walk down a hall to an elevator down to the basement where the restaurant is. Feels like you're stepping back in time and the atmosphere is so enjoyable and relaxing. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary by splitting the Caesar salad which were still good size portions even split in half and the dressing was delicious. I went with the Pappardelle con astice (warm lobster on a bed of wide pappardelle noodles) - so good! Wife had beef tenderloin on bed of mashed potatoes and vegetables and she said it was so nice and tender and melted in mouth. We split tiramisu for dessert and it was phenomenal as well. Everything from server, food, experience was 5 stars.
Great place for a romantic evening. Customer service was on point and food was delicious.
Quiet cozy real Italian food. WZiters are all from Italy and give great recommendations
